intro: Silaus selinoides, commonly known as the silverleaf tansy, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its finely divided, silver-gray leaves and yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its aromatic properties. Silaus selinoides thrives in dry, sunny environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its medicinal uses have been explored historically, though it is considered toxic in large quantities.
